text: This is a list with brief descriptions of Topps sports card products for 1973. ==Baseball== {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Set !Cards in Set !Dimensions |- |Base set |660 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |Blue Team Checklists |24 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |} ===Parallel Sets=== Since 1965, the Canadian candy company O-Pee-Chee produced virtually identical sets identical to the Topps issue of the same year. The Canadian printed cards were printed on grey cardstock and featured French and English text on the reverse. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Set !Cards in Set !Dimensions |- |O-Pee-Chee |660 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |Blue Team Checklists |24 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |} ==Football== In 1973, Topps issued two Football sets featuring the National Football League. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Set !Description !Cards in Set !Size |- |Base set | |528 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |Team Checklists | |26 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |} ==Hockey== {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Set !Description !Cards in Set !Size |- |Base set | |198 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |} ==Basketball== Topps issued one set featuring the two professional basketball leagues, the National Basketball Association and the American Basketball Association, playing during the 1972-1973 season. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Set !Description !Cards in Set !Size |- |Base set | |264 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |} ==References== * Beckett, Dr. James et al. (2002). "Beckett Baseball Card Price Guide". Beckett Publications-Dallas, Texas Category:Chewing gum Category:Baseball cards Category:Trading cards Category:Topps
title: 1973 Topps
